FOUND IN: Tuxford - A market town in the Borough of Newark and Sherwood, Nottinghamshire
Goslings - baby geese, particularly before they learn to swim and walk properly.
Venus - Goddess of love, beauty, and fertility in Roman mythology, equivalent to Aphrodite from Greek mythology.
Enraptured - delightedly captivated or charmed by something enthralling.
Orange - A color resulting from the mixture of red and yellow hues, often associated with warmth, vitality, and energy.

Apocalypse Now (also known as "Apocalypse Now, Redux") - directed by Francis Ford Coppola and based on Joseph Conrad's novel "Heart of Darkness." The movie was released in theaters in 1979 but also had a special edition titled "Redux" in 2001.

FOUND IN: Commend - While not exactly the same as "go to see," it can imply a positive reason for visiting.
Elixir - A magical or medicinal liquid, often associated with alchemy and potions in folklore.
Baseline - The line at each end of a tennis court, marking the boundary closest to the net.
Factory worker - A person who operates machinery in a manufacturing plant, often performing repetitive tasks as part of their job duties.
Misinterpret - To explain, describe, or conceptualize inaccurately.
